00011 DataspaceUnit::DataspaceUnit(char *cName)
00012 {
00013         name = gensym(cName);
00014 }

00019         ;

00024 
00025 DataspaceLib::DataspaceLib(char *cName, char *cNativeUnit)
00026         : inUnit(NULL), outUnit(NULL)
00027 {
00028         unitHash = hashtab_new(0);
00029         name = gensym(cName);
00030         neutralUnit = gensym(cNativeUnit);
00031 }
00032 
00033 
00034 DataspaceLib::~DataspaceLib()
00035 {
00036         t_symbol                **keys = NULL;
00037         long                    numKeys = 0;
00038         long                    i;
00039         DataspaceUnit   *unit;
00040 
00041         hashtab_getkeys(unitHash, &numKeys, &keys);
00042         for(i=0; i<numKeys; i++){
00043                 hashtab_lookup(unitHash, keys[i], (t_object**)&unit);
00044                 delete unit;
00045         }
00046         hashtab_chuck(unitHash);
00047 }
00048 
00049 
00050 // remember, we are relying on memory passed in for the outputAtoms             
00051 JamomaError DataspaceLib::convert(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00052 {
00053         double  value;
00054         long    numvalues;
00055         
00056         if(inUnit->name == outUnit->name){
00057                 *outputNumArgs = inputNumArgs;
00058                 sysmem_copyptr(inputAtoms, *outputAtoms, sizeof(t_atom) * inputNumArgs);
00059         }
00060         else{
00061                 inUnit->convertToNeutral(inputNumArgs, inputAtoms, &numvalues, &value);
00062                 outUnit->convertFromNeutral(1, &value, outputNumArgs, outputAtoms);
00063         }
00064         return JAMOMA_ERR_NONE;
00065 }
00066 
00067                 
00068 JamomaError DataspaceLib::setInputUnit(t_symbol *inUnitName)
00069 {
00070         if(inUnit && inUnitName == inUnit->name)        // already have this one loaded
00071                 return JAMOMA_ERR_NONE;
00072         else
00073                 return (JamomaError)hashtab_lookup(unitHash, inUnitName, (t_object**)&inUnit);
00074 }
00075 
00076 
00077 JamomaError DataspaceLib::setOutputUnit(t_symbol *outUnitName)
00078 {
00079         if(outUnit && outUnitName == outUnit->name)     // already have this one loaded
00080                 return JAMOMA_ERR_NONE;
00081         else
00082                 return (JamomaError)hashtab_lookup(unitHash, outUnitName, (t_object**)&outUnit);
00083 }
00084 
00085 
00086 void DataspaceLib::registerUnit(void *unit, t_symbol *unitName)
00087 {
00088         hashtab_store(unitHash, unitName, (t_object*)unit);
00089 }
00090 
00091 
00092 void DataspaceLib::getAvailableUnits(long *numUnits, t_symbol ***unitNames)
00093 {
00094         hashtab_getkeys(unitHash, numUnits, unitNames);
00095 }

00100 /***************************************************************************
00101         Interface for Instantiating any DataspaceLib
00102  ***************************************************************************/
00103 
00104 #include "TemperatureDataspace.h"
00105 
00106 
00107 JamomaError jamoma_getDataspace(t_symbol *dataspaceName, DataspaceLib **dataspace)
00108 {       
00109         if(*dataspace){
00110                 if(dataspaceName == (*dataspace)->name)
00111                         return JAMOMA_ERR_NONE; // already have this one, do nothing...
00112                 else{
00113                         delete *dataspace;
00114                         *dataspace = NULL;
00115                 }
00116         }
00117 
00118         // These should be alphabetized
00119         if(dataspaceName == gensym("temperature"))
00120                 *dataspace = (DataspaceLib*) new TemperatureDataspace;
00121         else 
00122                 // Invalid -- default to temperature
00123                 *dataspace = (DataspaceLib*) new TemperatureDataspace;
00124         
00125         return JAMOMA_ERR_NONE;
00126 }
00127 
00128 
00129 // This function allocates memory -- caller must free it!
00130 void jamoma_getDataspaceList(long *numDataspaces, t_symbol ***dataspaceNames)
00131 {
00132         *numDataspaces = 1;
00133         *dataspaceNames = (t_symbol**)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_symbol*) * *numDataspaces);
00134         
00135         // These should be alphabetized
00136         if(*numDataspaces){
00137                 *(*dataspaceNames+0) = gensym("temperature");
00138         }
00139 }
